intro: Hypobathrum multibracteatum, commonly known as the many-bracted hypobathrum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Hypobathrum multibracteatum is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
